disclaimerText: This forecast is intended to provide information on expected pollution levels in areas of significant public exposure. It may not apply in very specific locations close to unusually strong or short-lived local sources of pollution.

currentForecast.forecastSummary: Low air pollution forecast valid from Friday 27 May to end of Friday 27 May GMT
currentForecast.forecastText: Friday will be dry with sunny spells, but still windy.<br/>A fresh relatively 'clean' westerly breeze will ensure good dispersion of any local emissions.<br/><br/>Air pollution is expected to remain 'Low' throughout the forecast period for the following pollutants:<br/><br/>Nitrogen Dioxide<br/>Ozone<br/>PM10 Particulate<br/>PM2.5 Particulate<br/>Sulphur Dioxide<br/><br/>

currentForecast.forecastSummary: Low air pollution forecast valid from Saturday 28 May to end of Saturday 28 May GMT
currentForecast.forecastText: Saturday is expected to be dry with sunny spells.  Winds are still Atlantic in origin, but becoming more north westerly.<br/><br/>With a relatively 'clean' air flow and good dispersion of local emissions, air pollution is expected to remain 'Low' throughout the forecast period for the following pollutants:<br/><br/>Nitrogen Dioxide<br/>Ozone<br/>PM10 Particulate<br/>PM2.5 Particulate<br/>Sulphur Dioxide<br/><br/>
